title: Fork Tines, Knife, Sheath Or Fork Handle, 1985-103-1-a/c, ca. 1780–1820
creditline: The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg
description:
Set consisting of:
Knife (a): Blade has straight upper edge, lower edge tapering upwards to the point; curved bone handle, metal end, baluster ferrule and metal end. 
Sheath (b): shaped stitched leather with reeded metal end collar and tip guard; end of metal tip fitted with screw pocket to hold fork. Has extra slot for fork when not in use. 
Flat two-pronged fork (c): can be screwed on to sheath.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005
